entries.notes: Some MSS. copies indicate 'Andante' for movement 2. Almost all the MSS. copies indicate 'Presto' for movement 3.

ms_copies_score: Prague, Národní Muzeum. Two copies: XLI.C.103 and XLII.F.478, 'Concertino no. 1...'. The presentation of the theme of the second movement is slightly different in the Prague MS.
Stockholm, Kungl. Musik Akad. Bibl., W4-R.
Venice, Bib. Marciana, It. IV. 1255 (= 11.162). Two violins parts only.
sources.first_edition: April, 1767, Paris, Vénier: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159).
later_editions: (c. 1773), London, Welcker: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159).
(c. 1805), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159).
(c. 1835), Paris, Boyer-Naderman: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159).
(c. 1835), London, Preston: Op. 1 no. 4 (for title, see No. 159).
arrangements: Of the first two movements, as part of a sonata for harpsichord (or pianoforte) and violin, by 'Mlle Le Jeune', c. 1785 (see No. 50).

partial_notes: Page starts with continuation of entry 163 from previous page, showing manuscript sources and publication history.
